title: Can European Energy Cope with a Conflict in Ukraine?
description: Ukraine used to be the main corridor for delivering Russian gas to Europe; it is no longer that, though it remains significant for certain countries. This is the backdrop for thinking about what a conflict in Ukraine could mean for European energy security.

title: Maritime Security Dialogue: FIFTH Fleet Mission and Operations Update
description: Join CSIS and the U.S. Naval Institute for a Maritime Security Dialogue event featuring Vice Admiral Brad Cooper, Commander, United States Naval Forces, Central Command/Commander, FIFTH Fleet and Commander, Combined Maritime Forces on Friday, January 14, 2022 at 10 a.m. ET.

title: Regional Competition and the Future of Russia-Turkey Relations
description: This report analyzes the nature of Russo-Turkish regional competition and the future of relations between the two countries.

title: What to Watch in Sub-Saharan Africa in 2022
description: The CSIS Africa Program previews some of the top stories and trends in the region for 2022.

title: Spotlight - Malaysia: January 20, 2022
description: Another corruption scandal emerged in Malaysia over the holidays, highlighting the difficulty successive governments have had in putting an end to systematic abuse of power.

title: Spotlight - Cambodia: January 20, 2022
description: Fifteen months after Cambodian prime minister Hun Sen and Chinese foreign minister Wang Yi put pen to paper in Phnom Penh, agreeing to the Cambodia-China Free Trade Agreement (FTA), the pact finally took effect on January 1, 2022.

title: The Latest on Southeast Asia: January 20, 2022
description: After a slow start, the Biden administration has begun to secure confirmation of some top diplomatic appointees for Southeast Asia. Several important posts, however, remain not only vacant but without any nominee.

title: Costa Rica, the Dominican Republic, and Panama: A New Alliance for Promoting Democracy and Prosperity in the Americas
description: William A. Schreyer Chair, Daniel F. Runde, testified before the Senate Foreign Relations Western Hemisphere Subcommittee on the importance of U.S. engagement on vaccines in Latin America and the Caribbean.

title: In Thailand, Pandemic Unites Old Factions in Discontent
description: As Thailand emerges in fits and starts from nearly one and a half years under pandemic paralysis to a “new normal,” traditional political divisions by geography and class have faded.

title: The Limits of Internationalizing Hong Kong’s Democracy Struggle
description: Repression in Hong Kong is not slowing down. Why has Beijing’s clampdown persisted despite international pressure?

title: Post-Covid-19 Economic and Health Recovery in Laos
description: In the coming year, the Lao government and international donors should focus on vaccinations and investments in the economy and healthcare sector to stabilize GDP growth and bolster healthcare infrastructure.

title: The Middle East and North Africa in International Relations: The Changing Dynamics of Regional and National Security
description: The United States must adapt to the series of radical shifts in the Middle East and North Africa region, writes CSIS’s Emeritus Chair in Strategy.
